title: Matrices of dimension 0 and 1
content: As already mentioned before, and shown in ~ mat0dimbas0 , the empty set is the sole zero-dimensional matrix (also called "empty matrix", see Wikipedia ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matrix_(mathematics)#Empty_matrices). In the following, some properties of the empty matrix are shown, especially that the empty matrix over an arbitrary ring forms a commutative ring, see ~ mat0dimcrng . For the one-dimensional case, it can be shown that a ring of matrices with dimension 1 is isomorphic to the underlying ring, see ~ mat1ric .

blocks.name: mat0dimbas0
blocks.content: The empty set is the one and only matrix of dimension 0, called "the empty matrix". (Contributed by AV, 27-Feb-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mat0dimbas0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), csn(emptycls)))
} = {
  3eqtr3d(cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), csn(emptycls), co(cfv(cbs, c0), cmap, cxp(emptycls, emptycls)), c1o, wcel(c0, c1))
  eqtrd(co(cfv(cbs, c0), cmap, cxp(emptycls, emptycls)), c1o, co(cfv(cbs, c0), cmap, emptycls), wcel(c0, c1))
  oveq2d(cfv(cbs, c0), cmap, cxp(emptycls, emptycls), emptycls, wcel(c0, c1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cxp(emptycls, emptycls), emptycls))
  0xp(emptycls)
  mp1i(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(cfv(cbs, c0), cmap, emptycls), c1o), wcel(cfv(cbs, c0), universe))
  fvex(cbs, c0)
  map0e(cfv(cbs, c0), universe)
  mpan(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(cfv(cbs, c0), cmap, cxp(emptycls, emptycls)), cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))), wcel(emptycls, cfn))
  0fin()
  matbas2(emptycls, c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
  eqid(co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c1o, csn(emptycls)))
  df1o2()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mat0dimbas0(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(Base `(‚àÖ[Mat]c0))= { ‚àÖ })
} = {
  3eqtr3d((Base `(‚àÖ[Mat]c0)), { ‚àÖ }, ((Base ` c0)[‚Ü¶](‚àÖ √ó ‚àÖ)), c1o, c0 ‚àà c1)
  eqtrd(((Base ` c0)[‚Ü¶](‚àÖ √ó ‚àÖ)), c1o, ((Base ` c0)[‚Ü¶]‚àÖ), c0 ‚àà c1)
  oveq2d((Base ` c0), cmap, (‚àÖ √ó ‚àÖ), emptycls, c0 ‚àà c1)
  a1i(c0 ‚àà c1, (‚àÖ √ó ‚àÖ)= ‚àÖ)
  0xp(emptycls)
  mp1i(c0 ‚àà c1, ((Base ` c0)[‚Ü¶]‚àÖ)= 1o, (Base ` c0)‚àà ùïå)
  fvex(cbs, c0)
  map0e((Base ` c0), universe)
  mpan(c0 ‚àà c1, ((Base ` c0)[‚Ü¶](‚àÖ √ó ‚àÖ))=(Base `(‚àÖ[Mat]c0)), ‚àÖ ‚àà Fin)
  0fin()
  matbas2(emptycls, c0, c1, (Base ` c0), (‚àÖ[Mat]c0))
  eqid((‚àÖ[Mat]c0))
  eqid((Base ` c0))
  a1i(c0 ‚àà c1, 1o = { ‚àÖ })
  df1o2()
}

blocks.name: mat0dim0
blocks.content: The zero of the algebra of matrices with dimension 0. (Contributed by AV, 6-Aug-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mat0dim0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wceq(cfv(c0g, c1), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c1, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
} = {
  mpd(wcel(c0, crg), wceq(cfv(c0g, c1), emptycls), wcel(cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  3syl(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  mpan(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(emptycls, cfn))
  0fin()
  matring(emptycls, c0, c1)
  ringgrp(c1)
  grpidcl(c1, cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c1))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)), wceq(cfv(c0g, c1), emptycls), wcel(cfv(c0g, c1), csn(emptycls)))
  eleq2d(cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls), wcel(c0, crg))
  syl5eq(cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls), cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), wcel(c0, crg))
  fveq2i(cbs, c1, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
  mat0dimbas0(c0, crg)
  elsni(cfv(c0g, c1), emptycls)
}

blocks.name: mat0dimid
blocks.content: The identity of the algebra of matrices with dimension 0. (Contributed by AV, 6-Aug-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mat0dimid(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wceq(cfv(cur, c1), emptycls))

} = {
  mpd(wcel(c0, crg), wceq(cfv(cur, c1), emptycls), wcel(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)), wcel(c1, crg))
  mpan(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, crg), wcel(emptycls, cfn))
  0fin()
  matring(emptycls, c0, c1)
  ringidcl(c1, cfv(cur, c1), cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cur, c1))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(cbs, c1)), wceq(cfv(cur, c1), emptycls), wcel(cfv(cur, c1), csn(emptycls)))
  eleq2d(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls), wcel(c0, crg))
  syl5eq(cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls), cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), wcel(c0, crg))
  fveq2i(cbs, c1, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
  mat0dimbas0(c0, crg)
  elsni(cfv(cur, c1), emptycls)
}

blocks.name: mat0dimscm
blocks.content: The scalar multiplication in the algebra of matrices with dimension 0. (Contributed by AV, 6-Aug-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mat0dimscm(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))), wceq(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), emptycls))
  -| wceq(c2, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
} = {
  sylc(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))), wceq(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), emptycls), wcel(c0, crg), wcel(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), cfv(cbs, c2)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), cfv(cbs, c2)), wcel(c2, clmod), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c2))), wcel(emptycls, cfv(cbs, c2)))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(c2, clmod), wcel(emptycls, cfn), wcel(c0, crg))
  simpl(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  matlmod(emptycls, c0, c2)
  biimpa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c2))))
  eleq2d(c1, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c2)), wcel(c0, crg))
  fveq2d(cbs, c0, cfv(csca, c2), wcel(c0, crg))
  mpan(wcel(c0, crg), wceq(c0, cfv(csca, c2)), wcel(emptycls, cfn))
  0fin()
  matsca2(emptycls, c0, crg, c2)
  adantr(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(emptycls, cfv(cbs, c2)))
  syl5eleqr(emptycls, cfv(cbs, c2), csn(emptycls), wcel(c0, crg))
  snid(emptycls)
  0ex()
  lmodvscl(c2, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c2)), emptycls, cfv(cbs, c2), cfv(cvsca, c2), cfv(csca, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c2))
  eqid(cfv(csca, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cvsca, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(csca, c2)))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), cfv(cbs, c2)), wceq(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), emptycls), wcel(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), csn(emptycls)))
  eleq2d(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), cfv(cbs, c2), csn(emptycls), wcel(c0, crg))
  syl5eq(cfv(cbs, c2), csn(emptycls), cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), wcel(c0, crg))
  fveq2i(cbs, c2, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
  mat0dimbas0(c0, crg)
  elsni(co(c1, cfv(cvsca, c2), emptycls), emptycls)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mat0dimscm(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0))‚Üí(c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)= ‚àÖ)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(‚àÖ[Mat]c0)
} = {
  sylc((c0 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0)), (c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)= ‚àÖ, c0 ‚àà Ring, (c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)‚àà(Base ` c2))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0)), (c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)‚àà(Base ` c2), c2 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` c2)), ‚àÖ ‚àà(Base ` c2))
  sylancr((c0 ‚àà Ring ‚àß c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0)), c2 ‚àà LMod, ‚àÖ ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚àà Ring)
  simpl(c0 ‚àà Ring, c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0))
  matlmod(emptycls, c0, c2)
  biimpa(c0 ‚àà Ring, c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c1 ‚àà(Base `(Scalar ` c2)))
  eleq2d(c1, (Base ` c0), (Base `(Scalar ` c2)), c0 ‚àà Ring)
  fveq2d(cbs, c0, (Scalar ` c2), c0 ‚àà Ring)
  mpan(c0 ‚àà Ring, c0 =(Scalar ` c2), ‚àÖ ‚àà Fin)
  0fin()
  matsca2(emptycls, c0, crg, c2)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà Ring, c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0), ‚àÖ ‚àà(Base ` c2))
  syl5eleqr(emptycls, (Base ` c2), { ‚àÖ }, c0 ‚àà Ring)
  snid(emptycls)
  0ex()
  lmodvscl(c2, c1, (Base `(Scalar ` c2)), emptycls, (Base ` c2), (√ó ` c2), (Scalar ` c2))
  eqid((Base ` c2))
  eqid((Scalar ` c2))
  eqid((√ó ` c2))
  eqid((Base `(Scalar ` c2)))
  syl6bi(c0 ‚àà Ring, (c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)‚àà(Base ` c2), (c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)= ‚àÖ, (c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ)‚àà { ‚àÖ })
  eleq2d((c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ), (Base ` c2), { ‚àÖ }, c0 ‚àà Ring)
  syl5eq((Base ` c2), { ‚àÖ }, (Base `(‚àÖ[Mat]c0)), c0 ‚àà Ring)
  fveq2i(cbs, c2, (‚àÖ[Mat]c0))
  mat0dimbas0(c0, crg)
  elsni((c1[(√ó ` c2)]‚àÖ), emptycls)
}

blocks.name: mat0dimcrng
blocks.content: The algebra of matrices with dimension 0 (over an arbitrary ring!) is a commutative ring. (Contributed by AV, 10-Aug-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mat0dimcrng(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, ccrg))
  -| wceq(c1, co(emptycls, cmat, c0))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, ccrg), wcel(c1, crg), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))))))

  matring(emptycls, c0, c1)
  mpcom(wcel(c0, crg), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))))), wceq(cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), csn(emptycls)))
  mat0dimbas0(c0, crg)
  sylbi(wceq(cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), csn(emptycls)), wi(wcel(c0, crg), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0)))))), wceq(cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls)))
  eqeq1i(cfv(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0)), csn(emptycls), cfv(cbs, c1))
  fveq2i(cbs, co(emptycls, cmat, c0), c1)
  eqcomi(co(emptycls, cmat, c0), c1)
  ex(wceq(cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls)), wcel(c0, crg), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))))))

  sylibr(wa(wceq(cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls)), wcel(c0, crg)), wral(hs0, csn(emptycls), wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))))), wceq(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls), co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls)))
  eqidd(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls), wa(wceq(cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls)), wcel(c0, crg)))
  bitri(wral(hs0, csn(emptycls), wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))))), wceq(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls), co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls)), wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls))))
  ralsn(hs0, emptycls, wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0)))), wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls))))
  ralbidv(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))), wceq(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls)))

  raleqbi1dv(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls), wral(hs1, cfv(cbs, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0)))), wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0)))))
  raleq(hs1, cfv(cbs, c1), csn(emptycls), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs0))))
  iscrng2(hs0, hs1, c1, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cmulr, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))

  diff.hs0.c(emptycls)
  diff.hs0.w(wral(hs1, csn(emptycls), wceq(co(emptycls, cfv(cmulr, c1), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), emptycls))))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls))

blocks.name: mat1mhm
blocks.content: There is a monoid homomorphism from the multiplicative group of a ring to the multiplicative group of the ring of matrices with dimension 1 over this ring. (Contributed by AV, 22-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: mat1rhm
blocks.content: There is a ring homomorphism from a ring to the ring of matrices with dimension 1 over this ring. (Contributed by AV, 22-Dec-2019.)
